smac.controller

Class RoutingController

  • java.lang.Object
    • smac.controller.RoutingController

  • public class RoutingController
extends java.lang.Object
    The RoutingController class routes a SEPAmail message to its appropriate output queue based on the set of rules defined in the SMAC daemon configuration file.
    Version:
    0.5
    Author:
    Bishan Kumar Madhoo

    • Method Detail

      • route

        public void route(RoutingTask routingTask)
           throws RuleNotFoundException
        Determine the output queue of a SEPAmail message
        Parameters:
        routingTask - SMAC daemon routing task which points to a related SEPAmail message
        Throws:
        RuleNotFoundException

      • getGeneralRule

        private Rule getGeneralRule(SmacQueueType inputQueueType)
        Get the appropriate general rule by which will be used to route the given message to its output queue
        Parameters:
        inputQueueType - Routing task input queue type
        Returns:
        The general rule that will be used to route the message if it has been defined

      • getMatchingRules

        private java.util.ArrayList<Rule> getMatchingRules(java.lang.String from,
                                         java.lang.String to,
                                         SmacQueueType inputQueueType)
        Get a list of rules which matches the given to and from addresses and input queue type
        Parameters:
        from - The SEPAmail message sender's email address
        to - The SEPAmail message recipient's email address
        inputQueueType - Routing task input queue type
        Returns:
        List of rules which match the given set of criteria

      • doPreliminaryRouting

        private void doPreliminaryRouting(RoutingTask routingTask,
                        java.lang.String mode)
        Route associated SEPAmail message container files based on the 'sepamail-mode' code
        Parameters:
        routingTask - SMAC daemon routing task
        mode - 'sepamail-mode' code as specified in the SEPAmail message container file
